instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01061: What is 820-01061? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00597: What is 820-00597? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 2017 A1418 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01061</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
A1418, I was installing Monterey on a ssd connected USB.  Machine randomly switched off during the process, immediately switched back on and started the install again, after a while it randomly switched off again.

I removed the screen and found that when I plugged in the power the fan immediately started to spin and LED 1&2 were lit.  Did some digging and found a suggestion here to try removing the RAM to check for bleeps.  I've done that but now the second LED blinks and the fan doesn't spin up - even after installing the ram and reassembling. 


I have had a quick look for a schematic but not found one.  In this scenario I'm thinking to try a new PSU first but they are horrendously priced so before I spend loads of money does any one have any suggestions or possibly a schematic?

threads.title: 2017 A1418 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01061</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
No schematic available for this model.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00597</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is the closest model to use.

12V lab PSU can be used to power <SIGNAL>12V_G3H</SIGNAL> rail.
Set amp limit to max first.
